org.lwjgl.openal

Class ALContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.Pointer.Default
      • org.lwjgl.openal.ALContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer

    public class ALContext
extends Pointer.Default
    This class represents an OpenAL context within an OpenAL device. It wraps an ALDevice instance, an ALCcontext pointer and an ALCapabilities instance that exposes the context capabilities.

    Calling OpenAL functions requires that an OpenAL context is made current, either process-wide or in the current thread. The methods ALContext.makeCurrent() and ALContext.makeCurrentThread() can be used for that purpose.

    See Also:
    ALDevice, AL

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public ALDevice getDevice()
        Returns the ALDevice instance associated with this OpenAL context.

      • getCapabilities

        public ALCapabilities getCapabilities()
        Returns the ALCapabilities instance associated with this OpenAL context.

      • makeCurrent

        public void makeCurrent()
        Makes this context the current process-wide OpenAL context. See AL.setCurrentProcess(org.lwjgl.openal.ALContext).

      • makeCurrentThread

        public void makeCurrentThread()
        Makes this context the current OpenAL context in the current thread. See AL.setCurrentThread(org.lwjgl.openal.ALContext).

        This method should only be used if the OpenAL implementation supports the ALC_EXT_thread_local_context extension. OpenAL Soft, the implementation that LWJGL ships with, supports this extension.

      • isCurrent

        public boolean isCurrent()
        Returns true if OpenAL methods called in the current thread would use this OpenAL context.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this OpenAL context by calling alcDestroyContext.

        If this OpenAL context is current when this method is called, AL.setCurrentThread(org.lwjgl.openal.ALContext) and AL.setCurrentProcess(org.lwjgl.openal.ALContext) will be called as necessary to clear the current context.

        The OpenAL device associated with this context is not closed after a call to this method.

      • create

        public static ALContext create()
        Creates an asynchronous ALContext, using the default device and default attributes.

        The created OpenAL context will be made the current process-wide context.

        Returns:
        the new ALContext

      • create

        public static ALContext create(ALDevice device)
        Creates an asynchronous ALContext, using the specified device and default attributes.

        The created OpenAL context will be made the current process-wide context.

        Returns:
        the new ALContext

      • create

        public static ALContext create(ALDevice device,
                               int frequency,
                               int refresh,
                               boolean sync)
        Creates an ALContext, using the specified device and attributes.

        The created OpenAL context will be made the current process-wide context.

        Parameters:
        device - the device
        frequency - the frequency for mixing output buffer, in units of Hz. Set to 0 to use the default.
        refresh - the refresh intervals, in units of Hz. Set to 0 to use the default.
        sync - a flag, indicating a synchronous context
        Returns:
        the new ALContext

      • create

        public static ALContext create(ALDevice device,
                               java.nio.IntBuffer attributes)
        Creates an ALContext, using the specified device and attributes.

        The created OpenAL context will be made the current process-wide context.

        Parameters:
        device - an OpenAL device
        attributes - null or a zero terminated list of integer pairs composed of valid ALC attribute tokens and requested values
        Returns:
        the new ALContext
